results.content: If you're serious about running a web development business, then this course is worth every penny. Actually, I'd go as far as to say it should be a prerequisite. Evan really knows his stuff and it shows. I've been in business before and have made many mistakes. His advice could have saved me a ton of money and many headaches, if only I'd taken this course sooner. I've read a countless business books and even spent, literally, 100 times what I paid for this course on another web development business training program, and the books and training program didn't even cover some of the fundamental topics covered here like how to actually manage clients when you get them and what to do in sticky situations when you run into a problem and can't find a solution. So yeah, you could A) try to stumble your way through business on your own (good luck with that) B) buy another course or book, which will probably pump you up and teach you how to cold call and write proposals (and if you're lucky touch on some project workflow techniques) or C) take this course and learn about the reality of the business world. Yes, it's a short course and no, it doesn't cover everything, but it's definitely worth a few dollars for what you'll get out of it!

So yeah, you could A) try to stumble your way through business on your own (good luck with that) B) buy another course or book, which will probably pump you up and teach you how to cold call and write proposals (and if you're lucky touch on some project workflow techniques) or C) take this course and learn about the reality of the business world. Yes, it's a short course and no, it doesn't cover everything, but it's definitely worth a few dollars for what you'll get out of it!

results.content:
I am a Professional trainer. His performance was quite strong for a standard tech guy. Congrats! I felt he was doing it for some time. I had to complete the whole course within 3 days due to my heavy working and international traveling schedule. Unconciously what he made was to awaken enlightning ideas to use in my Professional life and ideas rose which I could use on the web while I was sitting on this side of the table. 
Up sides: 
1) Content was well prepared. Not short, not long. Direct to the subject. I had the impression he worked on it. Not only verbally but also on the scenario. 
2) Live examples were good. (An idea: Could have been directed to more live exp.'s on a different document.)
3) The 7 reasons were quite powerful. It was mind blowing. I enjoyed it very much. Really. (For development: It did not give me a concrete idea in the beginning, who a web developer is and what s/he does. It was vague for me until the section where you started talking about clients. You could work on it a little bit more for newcomers.)
Down sides:
1) The Review materials were not too well structured. Only bullets. They were prepared as summary of the last section. If I read them say 3 months later, I could have forgotten the some parts of the theme. One has to re-watch the video. Could have been one step more self explaining (Say if I had to read them, I should have more recalls from that chapter. There are ways to do it.)
2) In first sections, you keep do this if you are not a programmer, do this if you are a programmer, do this if you are in between. This approach was a little confusing for me. You could have seperated them to 3 sections, so that if one is reading for him-her/self would not have to pick pieces of information and while gathering them loose or miss some of them. They would know in full and exactly what they had to do.
Sorry If I talked too much. But I enjoyed it a loooooot. Thank you very much. 
I have just decided to be a web developer. I have started a month ago. I have started to learn HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, Boothstrap4. I have started to build a website for our sales team. But I am even not in square 1. I am at square 0 :) So wish me luck and see you in the community. :)
To a better World...
Ali

My conclusion is that I'd go for very innovative niches in web development, or just change my focus.

I started the course having a few expectations of what I wanted to learn, specifically how to find out your niche and where to find clients. 

Now, having gone through most of the course, the advice and roadmap given is very comprehensive! In conjuction with a business planning book I'm reading now, this is helping me to finally start my own web development business. 

Thank you very much Evan for your valuable advice in this couse.
